text:
Does anyone know if it is possible to check if a CTA module is empty?

I have tried `{% if module.button != null %}`. To just use `{% if module.button %}` doesn’t work either.

When it is empty it prints as `null`, but `{% unless button is none %}` doesn’t work either.

>“The none expression test checks to see whether a variable has a null value.”
THANK YOU! That was driving me crazy :slightly_smiling_face:
Hello... I tried to use a custom module inside a hubl coded email template, but when I try to insert it using this snippet
I can show it in the email but i can't customize it :disappointed:
Your custom module is enable to use on email template?
Yes, this module is enable to use in email
Sorry <@UHGJ1MN14>, I found the source of this error... When I copied this module from another HS account, it didn't load the module fields settings, and I forget check it :flushed:

I am needing help with creating the scrolling like on the Apple HomePod page.  <https://www.apple.com/homepod/>

I would like to be able to scroll down a web page and then the background image locks for a couple of scrolls, while information scrolls over the image then after the information has passed the page continues scrolling.

If you can point me to a template with the module or a html for me to put in a module it would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you.
I would use a scrolling library
